DialogueDictionary.$HN2Entrance1:
TARGET RACE: "Hearthian"
LANGUAGE FOUND IN DATABASE
CONFIGURING ON-BOARD MEMORY STONES...DONE
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Entrance2: Welcome, [HEARTHIAN]! Whether you are here seeking a new life, or have simply come to visit out of curiosity, the Magister welcomes you to our humble community!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Entrance3: ERROR: ATTEMPT TO CONTACT MAGISTER FAILED (NULL REFERENCE EXCEPTION: FIELD "MAGISTER" NOT SET TO AN INSTANCE OF AN OBJECT), MANUAL FALLBACK REQUESTED.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Entrance4: Please head inside and request from anyone to be directed to the Magister, they will be happy to assist.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Warning1:
WARNING: Hatch insecure! Hatch mode set to MANUAL.
Reason: "To allow others to follow"
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Warning2: Remaining oxygen leaking out! Recommendation: Secure hatch immediately. Controls in Magister's room.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber1: VULTOS: The Device is nearly ready, Magister.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber2: MAGISTER: Good, good. A project millions of years in the making will finally see its conclusion.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber3: QUARTZ: When that geyser launched me into the stratosphere, I never would have reckoned it would be the start of something so...big.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber4: LILY: I don't think any of us had anticipated that the Magister's message would so completely change our lives.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber5: ROJA: It is certainly a strange feeling. I had no doubts in our Magister's ability, but it feels strange to know zat zis will all be over soon.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber6: VESPA: To travel new worlds, new universes, I have to admit, I am a little nervous about the whole prospect.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber7: ACQUARIUS: Aye, the feeling's understandable, mate. The unknown is...scary. But exploring the unknown is what yer good at. You'll do great out there.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Chamber8: MAGISTER: The Device passes inspection. Vultos, turn it on. Once it's ready...follow me to within.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2SealedDoor:
NO ENTRY!
This room has been sealed away due to the horrors contained within.
Make no attempt to enter without the Magister's express permission.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2DeviceHearthian: To roast marshmallows, that friendship around a campfire may never end.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineEntrance1: MAGISTER: Acquarius, are you all right?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineEntrance2: ACQUARIUS: Yeah, I'm fine, I've had far worse shocks. Shoulda turned the breaker off first, but I couldn't find it.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineEntrance3: MAGISTER: Oh, there is no breaker. Here. <snaps fingers> There, the power should be off.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineEntrance4: MAGISTER: Please, do not hesistate to ask me to turn off the power for you. I do not mind.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineEntrance5: ACQUARIUS: 'preciate it, boss, but I was more worried about disruptin' the others.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineEntrance6: ROJA: ACQUARIUS, DID YOU BREAK ZE LIGHTING? It's hard enough for me to paint normally!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery1: ACQUARIUS: ...and that's the last battery charged, including the spares.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery2: LILY: What are the spares for?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery3: ACQUARIUS: Boss wants me to put some extras in my room in case someone else comes and wants to follow us.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery4: LILY: Actually, I have been wondering: after we step into the device with our batteries in hand, we're not going to be able to come back. Who is going to turn the device off?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery5: ACQUARIUS: Oh, it won't be shut off. It's a little too complicated to just turn back on, so others who want to follow just need to read the mem'ry cubes and head into the device with one of the spare batteries.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery6: LILY: But won't that drain all the power? The Device certainly won't function without energy.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery7: ACQUARIUS: Don't worry, Boss says the reserve power should last right up until the sun goes Supernova.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EngineBattery8: LILY: Well, what about this room? Certainly all the power draw is going to cause a lot of stress on the ship. How will we know if the ship even survives until then?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryIntro1: Welcome to my Grand Archives. Over the thousands of millenia I explored the cosmos, I have hoarded the knowledge of many civilizations and recorded all of it here in this library.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryIntro2: Unless you are also 20 feet tall, please do not attempt to take any books from the larger shelves. For books you can safely hold, please ask Vultos for assistance with getting a translated copy in your language.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryArt1: VESPA: Roja, how do you do it?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryArt2: ROJA: Oh, lots of practice, yes.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryArt3: VESPA: Well, all the practice in the world won't help with your...
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryArt4: ROJA: Colorblindness? True, only being able to see ze world in various shades of red does make it difficult to paint, but it helps to do more abstract art like zis. Details become less important.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryArt5: VESPA: True, I have noticed you don't really paint landscape scenes like is common among my kind.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryArt6: ROJA: Ah, yes, I vould love to see some of your culture's arts! I vonder vat kind of secrets you would hide in zem.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryRR1: NOTICE: Access to the Reading Room is restricted while overdue books are taken out and unaccounted for. Please bring the books to this table and they will be returned automatically.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryRR2: As of the last scan (2 hours ago) there are three missing books:
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryRR3: SECRET LEGENDS: A Hero's Guide to Deciphering the Undecipherable, by Skip. Detected in: Dormatory, Vultos' room.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryRR4: THE COORDINATES CRASH, by Ixrecius. Detected in: Campfire Room
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryRR5: THE ASTEROID ARCADE, by Sir Zen Quobois XLII. Detected in: Library, above intended reading space. CAUTION: There is no architecture leading to the estimated location, excercise caution if you intend to seek it out.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret1: MAGISTER: Vultos, it does please me that you are just as interested in the secrets of the universe as I am.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret3: MAGISTER: Vultos, are you all right? You know you can always talk to me.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret5: MAGISTER: Vultos, do you still blame yourself?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret6: VULTOS: Look, I told you already, I'm not... I'm not ready to discuss that.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret7: MAGISTER: May I ask when you will be ready?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret8: VULTOS: Let's just focus on the Device. I've got a schematic written up, but I think I've hit a problem. The Device will have difficulty actually affecting someone with space protection.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret9: MAGISTER: Oh, Vultos, I suppose I was unclear. While it will take us out there, we will be in a state where we do not need such protection. No clothing will be needed, though if I am reading this right, a thin layer of clothes should still work fine.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibrarySecret10: VULTOS: Hmm, yes, of course. I'll make sure to set the Device so that it doesn't even try to fire if you are wearing too much for it.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp1: VULTOS: Well, it seems that campfires are a constant of the universe.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp2: QUARTZ: You sure it's ok for me to set one up in here?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp3: VESPA: Don't worry, I set up filters for the smoke. Indoor fires are a common thing for my kind.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp4: ACQUARIUS: 'Aight, lemme see these "marshmallows" you keep raving about.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp5:
QUARTZ: Of course! Here, you can eat one raw...yes, I know, their gooey flavor is the best thing in the universe. But watch this, you put it on a stick, roast it on the fire for a minute, and...
even better, a roasted marshmallow!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp7: MAGISTER: Yes, quite, the flavor is...something. But I believe it's incomplete...
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp8: QUARTZ: What? You dare insult the Hearthian Magnum Opus?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp9: MAGISTER: Oh, I would not dream of it. It is quite a flavor, even on its own. But, perhaps with the several of us here, the flavor can be enhanced. Lily, do you have any of those honey crackers?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp10: LILY: Of course, Magister! Here, I have a pack right now.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp11: MAGISTER: Wonderful! And Acquarius, do you have any chocolate?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp12: ACQUARIUS: Salted or unsalted? I got 'em both.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp13: MAGISTER: I'd like to try with the unsalted first. Break off a square, put it a cracker, then stick on a perfectly roasted marshmallow to melt it, and...top it with another cracker. Down the hatch...it is delicious!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Camp15: QUARTZ: Huh, had my doubts, but you're right, this is so good!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube1: VULTOS: Here is my room. It's not much, but our kind do have a thing for minimalism.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube2: QUARTZ: Ah, it's quite nice. You know, we don't really need much either. Just some boards, connected with sap and duct tape.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube3: VULTOS: It must be nice, such a simple life. Sleeping under the stars, eating marshmallows, and taking each day one at a time without a care in the world.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube4: QUARTZ: Yeah, but can't say I'm not looking forward to something brand new, even if it is a lot more complex.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube5: QUARTZ: By the way, what's your story, Vultos? You've been here the longest, right?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube6: VULTOS: Well, not quite: the Magister was here first. No one really knows his story. But, he did find me and rescue me. My escape pod landed on an uninhabited planet, and I lacked the skills for survival. I would have died, if he hadn't found me and brought me on board.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube7: QUARTZ: And it was then he presented you the idea for the Device, right? I admit, I still find the whole idea a little weird.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleCube8: VULTOS: It's undertandable to doubt our goal here. But it's for the good of all. We must ensure this universe does not truly die.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleSecret1: VULTOS: It's really been 200 years since that day, huh. 200 years since...I ran like a coward.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleSecret2: VULTOS: The Magister and Vespa always try to console me, and I know they're right. Had I stayed, I'd have died with the rest of them.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleSecret3: VULTOS: Still, that doesn't make it hurt any less. The idea that...I didn't deserve to be rescued. I should have died on that green planet, fallen into one of the geysers and drowned.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2FoxleSecret5: VULTOS: I should get back to work on my schematics.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube1: VESPA: And that's four games in a row. Best five out of nine?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube2: VULTOS: Ha, you bet! I'll win one of these days!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube3: ACQUARIUS: Methinks maybe ya should give up, you haven't won a game in nearly two hundred years!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube5: ACQUARIUS: Back where I come from, 'tis considered wisdom to know when to stop. I'd have shocked myself to death long ago if I simply kept banging me head against me problems. Vul, 'ow about taking a break, ya? I know yer in a hurry to win, but patience is a virtue.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube2-1: VESPA: Are you alright? I've never used a Vision Torch on another race...
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube2-2: MAGISTER: No, I, I am all right. This technology is quite unique. Projection is a key function the Device needs.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube2-3: VESPA: Would you like to try it? Here, you should be able to use the Torch...
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkCube2-4: MAGISTER: No, thank you, I've gathered all the data I need from it already.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OWLKCube2-6: VESPA: What goes on in that mind? Who are]]> you?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2NomaiCube1: QUARTZ: Wow, I've seen Nomai stuff before, but never so...fresh and clean.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2NomaiCube3: QUARTZ: I wish, but all the Nomai my kind have found have died long ago. There are plenty of ruins of theirs, but we have no idea what happened to them. Their buildings are all abandoned.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2NomaiCube5: QUARTZ: Oh, sorry, I, I didn't think about it. I mean, I'm sure there are more Nomai out there...
DialogueDictionary.$HN2NomaiCube6: LILY: Oh, no, don't let me be a downer! Come on, you still have many others to meet! And we still need to determins what technology you can contribute to the Device.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube2: VULTOS: This is quite a garden you've got here. I guess you have a lot of experience with plants?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube3: ROJA: Oh! I did not see you zere! Yes, I am a master gardener. It vas my main hobby back home, and quite a valueable profession.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube4: VULTOS: Oh, really, why is that?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube5: ROJA: Oh, vell you see, my kind has extremely limited color vision. Many colors you can distinguish appear identical to us. As ve are an herbivorous species, being able to determine vat a plant vas vis our far more limited ability to really see zem vas an invaluable skill
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube6: VULTOS: I see. Well, I'm glad you have a hobby you enjoy so much, and you're able to be a big help to your kind.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube7: ROJA: Sank you for ze kind vords!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2RedeyeCube8: VULTOS: Brightening up other people's days is my calling.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube1: ROJA: Are you sure it is vise to leave a can of flammable liquid in a room made of vood?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube2: QUARTZ: Hmm? Why wouldn't it be? I'll be careful.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube3: ROJA: Yes, just like you vere careful to not fall in zat geyser.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube4: QUARTZ: Well, it turned out all right, didn't it? Had I not, I'd never have met you guys!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube5: ROJA: Zat is true.... Just promise me zat you von't cause a fire. I'd hate for something to happen to you, or my plants next door.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube6: QUARTZ: Of course! I shall do my best to ensure this is maintained responsibly.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube7: ROJA: Sank you. By the vay, vy do you even have it?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HearthCube8: QUARTZ: It's a special blend of flammable tree sap. I figure if there's anything I can contribute to the device, it's the Hearthian special fuel.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiDoor1: The Magister is not in right now. Entrance to his quarters are currently denied. Please come back later, the Magister will return in: 999,999 YEARS.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiKirmby1: I found this figure at a gift shop in some forgotten land. There were several versions of this character in various configurations, and almost all of them looked...adorable.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiKirmby2: But this one, this one...something about it just...fills me with a sense of ANGER and MALICE. As if...the only thing I want when I look at it is to BAN it from existance.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiKirmby3: Perhaps it was unwise to obtain something that affects me so negatively, but I am just so...intrigued by it.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiStart1: I woke up in this mysterious vessel.... I do not know who I am...what I am...or why I am here.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiStart2: What I do know: this ship is mine, it responds to my desires, and I have a myriad of these strange cubes that appear to record memories and play them at will...
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiStart3: And...I do not believe I have amnesia. I was...created here. This ship, created for me. But by whom?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiStart4: Well, there is a whole universe out there for me to explore.... The answer must be out there somewhere.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiEye1: Today I found something...universe shaking. A vortex, a power older than the universe, and I feel some...kinship, with it.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiEye2: I spoke with it, and it did not have any answers for me. It simply told me its purpose: to end all, that all might be born anew. Despite the tone some might interpret as sinister, it bears no ill will. Like...a decomposer, it serves a critical role in recycling death, so that more life may rise from the dead.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiEye3: But, must all end? True, this universe has a limited lifespan, but what if, what if we were not bound by this universe?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiEye4: The idea that all must end...that is the Lie of the Universe.... There must be a way to preserve the life of this universe beyond.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiFox1: As I was making my centennial trip to the vortex to see if there had been any new developments, I received a distress signal from a nearby planet. A young creature had been stranded there in his escape pod, and with his lack of survival skills, he would have surely died of starvation, or worse.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiFox2: I rescued him, of course, but when I asked him where he his home was so I could take him back, he said he had none. His kind had killed themselves off in a war, and he was the sole survivor of his race. His own planet was no longer even fit to live on. With that, he broke down sobbing.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiFox3: When he recovered, I offered him board, in return for his assistance. I had a plan to counter the Lie, and for that I would need to build a Device. However, this Device was based on connections, on community, and in order for it to function, I would need the collaboration of many others.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiFox4: Without hesitation, he agreed. I created a room for him, and we exchanged more information about each other. His name is Vultos. And my name is...my name...I...I told him that I am the Magister.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiLife1: I have encountered a major problem. I am immortal, and while the idea that a being would have a limited lifespawn is a known fact to me, it has just not occurred to me just how short a life is.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiLife2: Vultos is aging quite rapidly, and while he has been an invaluable asset in the creation of the Device, he will not live nearly long enough to see it be fired.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiLife3: Fortunately, I have a solution. An Immortality Crystal, installed as part of the Device, and completely preventing aging. It will not work for our ultimate goal, but it should allow anyone on this ship to survive long enough to see the day it is reached.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiOwlk1: I passed by an inhabited moon, and in disguise I visited the population in search of someone who would be willing to work on the Device. The beings here are bird-like, with antlers.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiOwlk2: I was recommended the house of one of them who was a young inventor, Vespa. She had created a telescope powered by flame, capable of detecting signals from space.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiOwlk3: It took some convincing, as she was understandably quite scared of the idea, but when I turned to leave, she changed her mind. It seemed that her fear of the unknown was overcome by her desire to see the cosmos she had studied all her life.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiOwlk4: On the ship, we talked about her and her kind. The name for their race roughly translates to "Inhabitants", but Vultos, spooked by her when she first arrived, wanted to call her "Ghost Bird.". She's not really a fan of the nickname, though. Considering that she seems to share traits with both owls and elks, I've presented the idea O-[REMAINING RECORDING CORRUPTED]
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiPiscen1: Today we crashed into an ocean planet. There was a malfunction with the engines and the ship was unable to counter the massive gravity when we tried to park.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiPiscen2: Fortunately, this planet is occupied by a friendly race of semiaquatic four-armed shark people, and one of them was kind enough to come aboard and try to fix the engines.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiPiscen3: He's an electrical engineer named Acquarius, and he's quite friendly despite how initimidating poor old Vultos finds him. He's even taller than Vespa, though of course nowhere near my true stature.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiPiscen4: He was absolutely fascinated by all of the equipment on our ship, and he actually asked to join our crew. Well, welcome aboard!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiNomai1: I came across yet another escape pod today, this one Nomaian in origin. Despite the massive capacity, there was only one member on board, by the name of Lily.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiNomai2: Like Vespa, she was an inventor, and she had created a Warp Core Anti-Distortion Safeguard. This component, meant to be equipped to their Vessels, would essentially "ping" the area a Vessel is attempting to warp to and check for distorted space. If such space was found, it would modify the warp coordinates slightly to prevent a potential disaster.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiNomai3: She planned to present this at a Festival, but her clan laughed at the idea. Distorted space was an unproven concept and the component was quite expensive to create. In a fit of anger, she used an Escape Pod in an attempt to get as far from her clan as possible.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiNomai4: I, however, was very interested in her tech and theories, and welcomed her aboard.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiRedeye1: Roja: botanist and fashion guru. Why did I let her on board?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiRedeye2: Do not get me wrong, I am happy to have a new member on our crew, but she is so...mischevious. I fear that she is one day going to poke around in this ship where she does not belong.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiRedeye3: Sigh...I am sure she will calm herself in time.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiHearthian1: Our deadline approaches. The Device is nearly complete, but we need one more component. I went to visit the vortex again, but on a nearby planet, I caught sight of a local Hearthian who had accidentally launched themself into space via a geyser.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2MagiHearthian2: They haven't even discovered space flight yet, but...well, I need help. Maybe this one, named Quartz, will provide the last component we need.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2JamSystem:
SYSTEM DESIGNATION: X3NJ-AM3
POPULATION: Unknown
Scanning in the immediate system running into interference
Interference origin: The sheer amount of communities that have once called this system their home
Interference also provides ideal environment for firing of the Device! Interdimensional barriers strained!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OWSystem:
SYSTEM DESIGNATION: Outer Wilds
POPULATION: 22.16
Home of the Hearthians
WARNING (Ignored): VORTEX SIGNAL NOT DETECTED
DialogueDictionary.$HN2OwlkSystem:
SYSTEM DESIGNATION: J0NC-RB3
POPULATION: None
Previously held a thriving civilization on a moon, the same moon is now a barren wasteland.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HNSystem:
SYSTEM DESIGNATION: Hearth's Neighbor
POPULATION: None
Extreme amounts of deadly matter and warped space detected.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HatchControls:
HATCH CONTROLS
Please stand clear of the docking bay while hatch is in motion.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem1: <![CDATA[<color=#0013FF>To wash away reget, that the sun may shine brighter tomorrow.</color>]]>
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem2: <![CDATA[<color=#00FF9F>To overcome fear, that the unknown may be greeted with open arms.</color>]]>
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem3: <![CDATA[<color=#3490FF>To build new monuments, that our mark may be left everlasting.</color>]]>
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem4: <![CDATA[<color=#8451FF>To preserve advancement, that the next generation may not suffer from our mistakes.</color>]]>
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem5: <![CDATA[<color=#FF7575>To maintain beauty, that a scene cherished once may be remembered forever.</color>]]>
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem6: <![CDATA[<color=#FF8B00>To roast marshmallows, that friendship around a campfire may never end.</color>]]>
DialogueDictionary.$HN2Poem7: To save the memory of a universe, that it may not die.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EntranceWall1: LILY: Well... I'm here, it seems. The "Magister" invited me here; let's see if he's as cordial as his invitation.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EntranceWall2: LILY: This technology is quite advanced. The cube here that greeted me decoded my language when I arrived. Perhaps it read from my memory?
DialogueDictionary.$HN2EntranceWall3: LILY: Hopefully, my talents will actually be appreciated here.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2DeviceNomai: LILY: To preserve advancement, that the next generation may not suffer from our mistakes.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2CampWall1: LILY: It took some searching for resources, but I've managed to install a special gravity crystal here.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2CampWall2: LILY: It projects a special kind of gravity field in the whole room, producing lighter gravity than this vessel's average further from it, and heavier gravity near it.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2CampWall3: LILY: And, as is typical for a crystal, it requires no power, so should something happen to this vessel's gravity, we can retreat to this room.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2CampWall4: LILY: This should be able to satisfy the various gravity requirements for us, so we can all relax in comfort together.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall1_1: LILY: We have a new friend today! Her name is Roja.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall1_2: LILY: She's a botanist, which I find very interesting. The way she sees plants must be quite unique. She's also an artist, and uses some interesting pallettes.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall1_3: LILY: The Magister put her room right after mine, so I'm no longer at the end of the hallway.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall1_4: LILY: It's always quite a sight to see the Magister at work, manipulating the shape of the this Vessel at will.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall2_1: LILY: I'm not usually one to brag, but I must say: my room looks quite a bit better than the others!
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall2_2: LILY: Only Vespa's room really even compares, to be honest. The others are quite...flat.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2HomeWall2_3: LILY: I admit, surrounded by familiar architecture, I am beginning to miss home. But I know that they probably aren't missing me. And I'm part of something much bigger here, anyway.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryWall2: LILY: You press the keys like this. It can take some practice to learn how to use a writing staff.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryWall4: LILY: Getting closer. Here, try adjusting your typing angle.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryWall6: LILY: One complicated topic at a time, sorry.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryBookcase1: LILY: I saw Vultos climbing the central pillar once. I'm not quite that athletic, but I'm hoping I can see what is up there from here.
DialogueDictionary.$HN2LibraryBookcase2: LILY: He is reading on top of the artificial sun! What does he need that much privacy for?

OtherDictionary.$HN2TimeStateLowGrav: MAGISTRATION NOTIFICATION: POWER LOW. REDUCING POWER TO NON-CRITICAL SYSTEMS, INCLUDING GRAVITY.
OtherDictionary.$HN2TimeStateNoGrav: MAGISTRATION NOTIFICATION: POWER VERY LOW. CUTTING POWER TO GRAVITY
OtherDictionary.$HN2TimeStateRedLights: MAGISTRATION NOTIFICATION: EMERGENCY POWER ONLY. OXYGEN PRODUCTION OFFLINE. RESERVE OXYGEN WILL DEPLETE IN THREE MINUTES.
OtherDictionary.$HN2TimeStateDead: MAGISTRATION NOTIFICATION: POWER DEPLETED,  SHUTTING DOWN...
